contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2011}} {{refimprove|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of Höchstädt |image= |caption= |partof=the War of the [[Second Coalition]] |date=19 June 1800 |place=[[Höchstädt an der Donau|Höchstädt]], Germany |result=French victory |combatant1={{flagicon|France}} [[French First Republic|France]] |combatant2={{flag|Holy Roman Empire}} [[Habsburg Monarchy|Austria]] |commander1=[[Jean Victor Marie Moreau]] |commander2=[[Pál Kray]] |strength1= |strength2= |casualties1= |casualties2= }} {{Campaignbox Second Coalition}} The '''Battle of Höchstädt''' was fought on 19 June 1800<ref name=nap>{{cite web|title=War of the 2nd Coalition (with Napoleon's 2nd Italian Campaign)|url=http://www.napoleon-series.org/military/listings/c_2ndcoalition.html|publisher=www.napoleon-series.org|accessdate=11 September 2012}}</ref> on the North bank of the [[Danube]] near [[Höchstädt an der Donau|Höchstädt]], and resulted in a French victory<ref name=nap>{{cite web}}</ref> under General [[Jean Victor Marie Moreau]] against the [[Austria]]ns under Baron [[Pál Kray]]. The Austrians were subsequently forced back into the fortress town of [[Ulm]].<ref>Herold, J. "The Age of Napoleon". Houghton Mifflin Company, 1963, p. 132.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord missing|Germany}} ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hochstadt (1800)}} [[Category:Conflicts in 1800]] [[Category:Battles of the French Revolutionary Wars|Hochstadt 1800]] [[Category:Battles involving Austria|Hochstadt 1800]] [[Category:1800 in Austria]] [[Category:1800 in France]] [[Category:Campaigns of the French Revolutionary Wars by year|1800]] [[Category:War of the Second Coalition]] [[Category:Battles of the War of the Second Coalition]] {{Napoleonic-battle-stub}} {{Austria-battle-stub}} {{France-battle-stub}}
